p: Heracleum mantegazzianum Sommier et Levier (giant hogweed) belongs to the genus Apiaceae. It was introduced to Europe from central Asia (Caucasus) as an ornamental species. The first information about its presence in Europe comes from London`s botanical garden Kew Gardens in 1817 [ 1, 2]. Nowadays, the plant is considered to be extremely dangerous in Slovakia as well as in other European countries as Czech Republic, Germany, Poland, Switzerland, and countries of Benelux, Great Britain etc. [ 3, 4, 5, 6, 7].
